alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Jennings; Johnson; Morgan; Rush; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Shelby, southern Rush, northeastern Morgan, Decatur, Johnson, northeastern Brown, Bartholomew and northeastern Jennings Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1132 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mooresville to Franklin to 7 miles east of Shelbyville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 64 and 97. Interstate 74 between mile markers 108 and 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Jennings; Johnson; Morgan; Rush; Shelby
